_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at Ever Green Co-op

Ever Green Co-op?s policy is to make sure that those who handle NH3 are employees who have been trained in how to properly handle NH3, and maintain the proper safety equipment.  Such as:  (Gloves, Goggles, Gas Masks, Rain Suits, etc.)    Employees that handle NH3 are required to attend an Annual Training Meeting that is performed by an outside Professional experienced in NH3.  The Emergency Responder #?s are displayed in a highly visible area so that customers and employee?s can easily spot them.    Some additional safety practices include:  1) Removing key from the ignition and unhooking the nurse tank from the vehicle when filling nurse tanks.  2) We have installed ?Tri Pods? on all  load out hoses.  ?Tri-Pods? are NH3 approved couplers that are designed to snap apart when someone pulls away with hoses hooked up.  This eliminates structure damage, broken hoses or pipes in event that someone pulls away when the hoses are still hooked up.  

Our Facility and the Regulated Substances Handled

Ever Green Co-op?s is a Farmer Owned Cooperative.  Located on a Farm NW of Tower City, ND.  We buy and sell fertilizer, seed, chemical and offer custom application of fertilizer and chemical. 
The regulated kind and quantity of fertilizer we handle consist of:  

     1)  Liquid fertilizer ? 500 tons 

     2)  NH3 ? 2000 tons 

     3)  Dry Fertilizer ? 3800 tons 

     4)  Micro Nutrients ? 200 tons

Five Year Accident History

We have had no accident or accidental releases in the past five years

The Emergency Response Program

Annually we send our Tier II reports to our two local Fire Departments ? Tower City, ND Fire Dept., and Valley City, ND Fire Dept.  In this report is a map of our facility along with the phone numbers of the Managers and/or the people in charge.  This report also includes a list of hazardous materials stored at this facility.   We also held and documented a Public

Notification Meeting.  Topics covered at our Public Notification Meeting were:
     ?  Properties of NH3
     ?  Safety Procedure you should do during a NH3 release
     ?  Demonstrated some safety equipment
     ?  Discussed offsite consequences
     ?  Concluded with a guest speaker from our Local Drug Enforcement Department

Planned Changes to Improve Safety at Ever Green Co-op

     ?  Increase the Training to twice a year instead of once a year

     ?  Closer Planned Inspections of Nurse Tanks in order to prevent theft of NH3 tanks

     ?  Continue to document all Maintenance & Inspections

     ?  Daily Inspection for Terrorism, Vandalism, or Drug Dealers/Users Activity
